metadata.name: Kernel Memory Dump Via LiveKD
metadata.comment: Detects execution of LiveKD with the "-m" flag to potentially dump the kernel memory

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\livekd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\livekd64.exe'))) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('livekd.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -m')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /m')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' –m')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' —m')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ―m'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of LiveKD with the "-m" flag to potentially dump the kernel memory

metadata.objective: False positive: Unlikely in production environment References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/livekd, https://4sysops.com/archives/creating-a-complete-memory-dump-without-a-blue-screen/, https://kb.acronis.com/content/60892
